me.pagekite.glen3b.library.bukkit.reflection

Class ReflectionUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.pagekite.glen3b.library.bukkit.reflection.ReflectionUtilities

  • public final class ReflectionUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
    Utilities involving reflection.
    Author:
    Glen Husman, microgeek
    See Also:
    Class, Method, Field, Constructor

    • Method Detail

      • createInstance

        public static <T> T createInstance(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                   java.lang.Object... args)
                        throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                               java.lang.SecurityException,
                               java.lang.InstantiationException,
                               java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                               java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                               java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        Creates an instance of the specified class.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The Class for which to create an instance.
        args - The arguments to pass to the constructor.
        Returns:
        An instance of the specified type created by the closest matching constructor.
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - If a SecurityManager blocks this operation.
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - If a constructor with the specified criteria does not exist.
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - If an exception occurs during the invocation of the constructor.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the incorrect number or type of arguments were specified.
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - If the constructor cannot be accessed. Due to the call to setAccessible, this exception should never be thrown.
        java.lang.InstantiationException - If the specified type cannot be created, such as if it is an abstract class.
        See Also:
        Constructor.newInstance(Object...)

      • getConstructor

        public static java.lang.reflect.Constructor<?> getConstructor(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                              java.lang.Class<?>... cArgs)
                                                       throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                                                              java.lang.SecurityException
        Gets a constructor, which may be inaccessible to public viewers due to access modifiers, for the specified class.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The Class for which to obtain the constructor.
        cArgs - The types of the arguments to pass to the constructor.
        Returns:
        The constructor instance with the specified criteria.
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - If a SecurityManager blocks this operation.
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - If a constructor with the specified criteria does not exist.

      • getPrimitiveForWrapper

        public static java.lang.Class<?> getPrimitiveForWrapper(java.lang.Class<?> wrapper)
                                                 throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Get the Class instance representing the primitive type of the specified wrapper class.
        Parameters:
        wrapper - The wrapper type for which to find the primitive type.
        Returns:
        The primitive type for the specified wrapper.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - Thrown if a matching primitive class cannot be found for the specified wrapper type.
        See Also:
        PrimitiveType

        public static java.lang.Class<?> getWrapperForPrimitive(java.lang.Class<?> primitive)
                                                 throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Get the Class instance representing the wrapper type of the specified primitive keyword.
        Parameters:
        primitive - The primitive type for which to find the wrapper type.
        Returns:
        The wrapper type for the specified primitive.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - Thrown if a matching wrapper class cannot be found for the specified primitive type.
        See Also:
        PrimitiveType

      • setValue

        public static void setValue(java.lang.Object instance,
            java.lang.String fieldName,
            java.lang.Object value)
                     throws java.lang.NoSuchFieldException,
                            java.lang.SecurityException,
                            java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                            java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Sets the value of a field on an Object instance via reflection.
        Parameters:
        instance - The instance of the class upon which to set the field.
        fieldName - The name of the Field to modify.
        value - The value of which the field will be set to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - If a SecurityManager blocks this operation.
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException - If the specified field does not exist.
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - If the field is not accessible for write, such as if it is final.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If an argument is invalid.
        See Also:
        Class.getDeclaredField(java.lang.String), Field.set(java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object)

      • invokeMethod

        public static java.lang.Object invokeMethod(java.lang.Object object,
                            java.lang.String method,
                            java.lang.Object... args)
                                     throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                            java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                            java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException,
                                            java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                                            java.lang.SecurityException
        Invoke a method on an object. This will iterate through all methods of the object to determine the appropriate overload.

        If a specific overload is desired, the following may be used instead to avoid the overhead of this method. 

                Method method = object.getClass().getMethod(method, argumentTypes);
        method.setAccessible(true);
        method.invoke(object, varArgs);

        Variable arguments methods must be invoked with a parameter of an array, not as a varargs invocation. That array must also be cast to Object so the varargs invocation of this method does not interpret that array as the argument array passed to this method.

        Parameters:
        object - The object upon which to invoke the method.
        method - The name of the method to invoke.
        args - The arguments to pass to the method. If this array is null, it will be treated as an empty array.
        Returns:
        The result of the invoked method.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException
        java.lang.SecurityException
        See Also:
        Class.getMethod(String, Class...), AccessibleObject.setAccessible(boolean), Method.invoke(Object, Object...)

      • getMethodsByName

        public static java.lang.reflect.Method[] getMethodsByName(java.lang.Class<?> declaredClass,
                                          java.lang.String name)
        Get an array of Method objects that have the specified name. If a method object is found, setAccessible(true will be called upon it.
        Parameters:
        declaredClass - The Class which will be searched for methods.
        name - The name of the method to retrieve.
        Returns:
        A non-null array of Methods which are the member overloads of the specified method.

      • getPackageVersionString

        public static java.lang.String getPackageVersionString()
        Gets the component of the package name of NMS and OBC classes which represents the minecraft server version. Determines this value by using the fully qualified class and package name of the CraftBukkit implementation class of Server.
        Returns:
        The version component of the NMS package running on this server.

      • getField

        public static java.lang.reflect.Field getField(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                               java.lang.String fieldName)
                                        throws java.lang.NoSuchFieldException,
                                               java.lang.SecurityException
        Gets a Field declared by a subtype of Object instance via reflection.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The type containing the field.
        fieldName - The name of the Field to retrieve.
        Returns:
        The object representing the reflectively obtained field.
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - If a SecurityManager blocks this operation.
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException - If the specified field does not exist.
        See Also:
        Class.getDeclaredField(java.lang.String), Field

      • getValue

        public static java.lang.Object getValue(java.lang.Object instance,
                        java.lang.String fieldName)
                                 throws java.lang.NoSuchFieldException,
                                        java.lang.SecurityException,
                                        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Gets the value of a field on an Object instance via reflection.
        Parameters:
        instance - The instance of the class which the field will be retrieved from.
        fieldName - The name of the Field to retrieve.
        Returns:
        The value of the field.
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - If a SecurityManager blocks this operation.
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException - If the specified field does not exist.
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - If the field is not accessible for write, such as if it is final.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If an argument is invalid.
        See Also:
        Class.getDeclaredField(java.lang.String), Field.get(java.lang.Object)
